availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William J. Williams (Simpson County, Ky, farmer, judge, and prov govt com rep)

body.p: Simpson County, Kentucky, farmer, judge, and provisional government representative. Kentucky native. Married to Henrietta Lane Williams in Warren County, Kentucky in February 1817. Father of A. G. Williams and M. H. Williams. Resident of Simpson County, Kentucky in 1820. Household owned two enslaved persons in Simpson County in 1820. Resident of Simpson County in 1830. Owned six enslaved persons in Simpson County in 1830. Farmer in Simpson County in 1850. Judge of Simpson County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
Fourth Manuscript Census of the United States (1820), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, Petersburg, p. 21, pp. 5 of microfilm.
Fifth Manuscript Census of the United States (1830), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 296, pp. 19-20 of microfilm.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, County, City/District, p. 4B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, Franklin, p. p. 145.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Warren County Marriages, Film #000164003, p. 248.
KYR-0004-033-0001.
